movies.title: Les maîtres du temps
movies.plot: Piel, a 7 or 8 year old boy, is alone on the desert planet Perdide, only survivor of an attack by giant hornets. Calling for help, Piel's father's friend Jaffar keeps contact with the kid and hurries across space toward Perdide.
movies.simplePlot: Piel, a 7 or 8 year old boy, is alone on the desert planet Perdide, only survivor of an attack by giant hornets. Calling for help, Piel's father's friend Jaffar keeps contact with the kid ...

biography.bio: Jean Valmont was born on October 4, 1936 in Paris, France. He is an actor and director, known for Fantastic Planet (1973), Les maîtres du temps (1982) and Let's Rob the Bank (1964).
biography.name: Jean Valmont

biography.bio: Michel Elias is an actor, known for Les maîtres du temps (1982), Les contes de la nuit (2011) and Taxi 2 (2000).
biography.name: Michel Elias

biography.bio: Frédéric Legros is an actor, known for Les maîtres du temps (1982).
biography.name: Frédéric Legros

biography.bio: Yves-Marie Maurin was born on April 19, 1944 in Toulouse, Haute Garonne, France. He was an actor, known for Spartakus and the Sun Beneath the Sea (1985), Diabolique (1955) and Les maîtres du temps (1982). He died on June 14, 2009 in Gentilly, Val-de-Marne, France.
biography.name: Yves-Marie Maurin

biography.bio: Monique Thierry is an actress, known for Les maîtres du temps (1982), Spartakus and the Sun Beneath the Sea (1985) and Gadget Boy and Heather (1995).
biography.name: Monique Thierry

biography.bio: Sady Rebbot was born on April 27, 1935 in Casablanca, Morocco. He was an actor and writer, known for My Life to Live (1962), Les maîtres du temps (1982) and Chi lavora è perduto (In capo al mondo) (1963). He died on October 12, 1994 in Paris, France.
biography.name: Sady Rebbot

biography.bio: Patrick Baujin is an actor, known for Les maîtres du temps (1982).
biography.name: Patrick Baujin

biography.bio: Pierre Tourneur is an actor, known for Les maîtres du temps (1982).
biography.name: Pierre Tourneur

biography.bio: Alain Cuny went to medical school with the intention of becoming a physician, but left to attend an arts school in Paris and became a painter. He entered the film industry as a costume and set designer for such directors as Alberto Cavalcanti and Jacques Feyder, all the time attending acting school. In the late 1930s he began acting professionally, first on stage and then in films. Cuny divided his time between making films in France and Italy, switching back and forth from romantic leads to solid character parts. His best remembered role is probably that of the conflicted philosopher in Federico Fellini's La Dolce Vita (1960).
biography.name: Alain Cuny

biography.birthName: Yves de la Chevardière de la Grandville
biography.bio: Yves Brainville was born on March 8, 1914 in Paris, France as Yves de la Chevardière de la Grandville. He was an actor and writer, known for The Man Who Knew Too Much (1956), Love and Death (1975) and The Sicilian Clan (1969). He died on November 16, 1993 in Paris.
biography.name: Yves Brainville

biography.bio: Michel Barbey was born on April 23, 1927 in Drucourt, Eure, France. He is an actor, known for Astérix et la surprise de César (1985), Les maîtres du temps (1982) and La horse (1970).
biography.name: Michel Barbey

biography.bio: Jim Bauman is an actor, known for Les maîtres du temps (1982).
biography.name: Jim Bauman

biography.bio: Michel Paulin is known for his work on Les maîtres du temps (1982), Dany the Ravager (1972) and Et Zeus se gratta la cuisse (1964).
biography.name: Michel Paulin

biography.bio: Very effective as the villain of the piece, the faithless Philippe de Gonzague, in André Hunebelle's entertaining version of Paul Féval's 'Le Bossu' (1959), François Chaumette worked wonders with his cruel look, his predatory smile and his coldly threatening manner. Unfortunately this brilliant thespian did not often appear on the big screen afterward. Indeed after making the respectable number of eleven films between 1957 and 1961, he would only appear in sixteen others until his death from cancer in 1996, among which shorts, unreleased feature films and one segment of 'Parano' in 1994. In spite of everything, François Chaumette did manage to land a few interesting roles in works by Robbe Grillet, Sautet and Zulawski. The reason why Chaumette worked so little for the cinema is simply due to the success he met at the theater in a long career that spanned five decades, from 1943 when he debuted in Giraudoux's 'Sodome et Gomorrhe' until his demise. He was also a fixture of French television where he appeared in filmed plays, serials, TV movies and historical dramas, including Claude Barma's famous series 'Belphégor' in which he shone as the arch villain (what else?) Boris Williams.
biography.name: François Chaumette

biography.bio: Henry Djanik was born on March 21, 1926 in France as Henry Djanikian. He is known for his work on Il était une fois... la vie (1986), Les maîtres du temps (1982) and The Night Caller (1975). He died on August 18, 2008 in France.
biography.name: Henry Djanik

awards.award: Academy of Science Fiction, Fantasy & Horror Films, USA 1983
